segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and type of the message.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time applying to the whole message, e.g., date and time of document issue.
TSR, A segment to identify the contract, conditions of carriage, services, and priority requirements for the transport.

FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as status of transport, remarks to be printed on the transport documents (where required), consignment remarks, insurance instructions, etc., or any other additional information.
CNT, A segment to specify totals for a consignment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify locations and related date(s)/time(s) which apply to the entire message, e.g. place of transshipment.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location applying to the entire message.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) relating to the location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments containing a reference and constants which apply to the entire message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message such as: the document/message number that is to be updated by this very message (according to data element 1225 Message Function, Coded in segment BGM), booking reference, order number, insurance contract, etc.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify customs and other governmental procedures and required documents.

segment.documentation: GOR, A segment to indicate applicable governmental procedures related to import, export and transport of the goods.
FTX, A segment to provide additional governmental requirements information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify required documents by government.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to indicate a document required by government.
DTM, A segment to specify the date/time related to the required document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of goods such as mode and means of transport, locations, departure, and arrival date(s) and time(s).

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to a certain stage of the transport, such as mode, means and carrier.
DTM, A segment to indicate departure/arrival date and time.
TSR, A segment to identify contract, conditions of carriage, services, priority requirements for this stage of transport.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location such as origin, destination, stop off, etc. related to this leg of transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify an additional reference related to the stage of the transport.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the additional reference.
DTM, A segment to identify date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to identify a party, related references, locations contacts, required documents, and charges to be paid by the party.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address, and function.
LOC, A segment to indicate location where a specific function will be performed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments identifying a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to identify required documents.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to identify a document required of, by or for the party.
DTM, A segment to identify date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify a reference related to the party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to identify the charge and its amount to be paid by the party.

segment.documentation: CPI, A segment to identify default charge methodology.
CUX, A segment to indicate payment currency related to the charge methodology.
LOC, A segment to identify the place of charge collection.
MOA, A segment to identify the monetary amount associated with the charges.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: SG14-SG15-SG16-SG17-SG18-SG20 A group of segments to describe the goods items for which transport is undertaken.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item for which transport is undertaken. A goods item can be identified by up to three levels of packaging.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item.
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.
RNG, A segment to specify a temperature range setting for a goods item.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for a goods item.
LOC, A segment to specify a country associated with a goods item, such as country of origin, or country of destination.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information relating to the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to identify different places of collection and/or delivery for the goods item.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify an address of a place of collection or delivery for a goods item.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the place of collection or delivery.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to describe the goods item.

segment.documentation: GDS, A segment to describe the nature of cargo.
FTX, A segment to describe the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to specify measurements applicable to a goods item.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to a goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.

segment.documentation: DIM, To specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to each of which the given dimension applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments to identify references to a goods item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference to a goods item.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments to specify documents and associated date(s) and time(s) for a goods item.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to specify a document prepared for a goods item.
DTM, A segment to associate date and time with the prepared document.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments to identify transport details and associated measurements for a goods item. This group may be repeated to indicate the different phases of the movement.

segment.documentation: TPL, A segment to identify transport details for a goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments to identify measurements.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify the distribution of a goods item among the transport details.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods, packing group, etc.
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name and to specify any additional dangerous goods information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments to identify a contact to whom communication regarding the dangerous goods can be directed.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments to identify dangerous goods measurements.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments to specify the distribution of the dangerous goods among the transport equipment.

segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to identify the equipment in which the dangerous goods are transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments to identify dangerous goods measurements.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of that portion of the dangerous goods in the equipment.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments to specify equipment in which goods are transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment, and equipment size and type used in the transport.
EQN, A segment to specify number of pieces of equipment required.
TMD, A segment to specify transport movement details for the equipment.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, associated with the equipment, such as weight.
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to equipment.
TPL, A segment to identify transport details for the equipment.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions for specified equipment.
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for the equipment.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments to identify different equipment pick-up or drop-off places.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify a pick-up or drop-off address.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to pick-up or drop-off.
